alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 7:16AM EDT until April 11 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Edwardsport. .Rain amounts of around an inch fell onto already high waters along the East Fork White near Seymour and White River at Edwardspoint which has brought or will bring renewed flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Edwardsport. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Flooding closes Old Vincennes Road. High water crosses SR 358 on the Daviess County side just west of the levee. Flooding begins to affect higher bottomlands. Residential property of river cabins begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM EDT Thursday /12:00 AM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 16.8 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
